docs.title: LitematicDownloader Documentation
docs.text: Welcome to the LitematicDownloader documentation! This mod helps you easily download and manage Litematica schematics for Minecraft.

docs.title: Quick Navigation
docs.text:
• About the Mod - Learn what LitematicDownloader is and what it does
  • Installation Guide - Step-by-step installation instructions
  • Features - Explore all the features and capabilities
  • Troubleshooting & Usage Guide - Get help with common issues and learn how to use each feature

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text:
If you're new to LitematicDownloader, we recommend this path:

  1. About the Mod - Understand what the mod does and its benefits
  2. Installation Guide - Get the mod installed and running
  3. Features - Discover all available features and capabilities
  4. Troubleshooting & Usage Guide - Learn how to use features and solve common issues

docs.title: Quick Links
docs.text:
• GitHub Repository
  • Discord Community
  • Visit choculaterie.com
  • Service Status

docs.title: What is LitematicDownloader?
docs.text:
Litematic Downloader is an extension for Litematica that allows you to browse, preview, and download schematics directly from choculaterie.com — without ever leaving Minecraft.

Manage all your schematics easily in-game with a full file manager and instant preview functionality. No more manual downloads or external file juggling — everything is streamlined inside your Minecraft client.

docs.title: Links
docs.text:
• GitHub Repository
  • Join our Discord Community

docs.title: Seamless Workflow
docs.text:
• Works directly within Minecraft alongside Litematica
  • No need for external tools or alt-tabbing
  • Extends existing Litematica functionality naturally

docs.title: Time Saving
docs.text:
• Browse and download schematics without leaving the game
  • Instant preview functionality
  • Streamlined file management

docs.title: Community Integration
docs.text:
• Direct access to choculaterie.com's schematic library
  • Publish your own builds in-game
  • Quick-share functionality for instant sharing

docs.title: Minecraft Compatibility
docs.text:
• Minecraft Version: 1.21.6+
  • Mod Loader: Fabric Loader (required)
  • Dependencies: Fabric-API Mod (required)

docs.title: Platform Support
docs.text:
• Currently only available for Fabric
  • Support for other loaders like Quilt or NeoForge is not provided

docs.title: Performance Requirements
docs.text:
• Standard Minecraft system requirements
  • Additional network permissions for schematic downloads
  • Minimal performance impact on gameplay

docs.title: How It Works
docs.text: LitematicDownloader integrates seamlessly with your existing Minecraft and Litematica setup. Once installed, you can access the mod interface using the default keybind "N" (customizable in vanilla keybind menu) to browse, download, and manage schematics directly from choculaterie.com without ever leaving your game.

docs.title: Features
docs.text: LitematicDownloader offers a comprehensive set of features to enhance your Minecraft building experience.

docs.title: Direct Access to choculaterie.com
docs.text:
• Search and download schematics directly from choculaterie.com within Minecraft
  • Browse the entire schematic library without leaving the game
  • Real-time search functionality with instant results

docs.title: Advanced Search & Filtering
docs.text:
• Search by name, author, or description
  • Filter by either build or redstone
  • Sort by likes, publish date, or download count
  • Add schematics to your favorites

docs.title: Complete File Management
docs.text:
• Organize, rename, delete, and manage your schematic files entirely in-game
  • Create custom folder structures
  • Batch operations for multiple files
  • Duplicate detection and cleanup

docs.title: Preview System
docs.text:
• Schematic details and descriptions
  • 3D visualization before downloading
  • Build information and cover image display

docs.title: Smooth Workflow Integration
docs.text:
• Seamlessly extends the existing Litematica workflow
  • No need for external tools or file juggling
  • Direct loading into Litematica's placement system

docs.title: Enhanced Functionality
docs.text:
• Works alongside all existing Litematica features
  • Preserves all schematic metadata and properties

docs.title: In-Game Publishing
docs.text:
• Instantly upload and publish your builds to choculaterie.com
  • No need to leave Minecraft to share your creations
  • Simple interface: select schematic, add name, description, etc.

docs.title: Account Integration
docs.text:
• Link your Minecraft account to choculaterie.com
  • Manage your published schematics

docs.title: Instant Sharing (NEW!)
docs.text:
• Generate unique URLs for immediate sharing
  • No account or publishing required
  • Share builds with friends instantly
  • Works with any schematic file

docs.title: 3D Web Viewer
docs.text:
• Recipients can view schematics in 3D web viewer
  • Interactive exploration without Minecraft
  • Cross-platform accessibility
  • Direct download links included

docs.title: Intuitive Design
docs.text:
• Clean, user-friendly interface
  • Consistent with Minecraft's design language
  • Customizable keybinds (default: "N")
  • Responsive controls and navigation

docs.title: Accessibility Features
docs.text:
• Keyboard navigation support
  • Scalable interface elements
  • Clear visual feedback
  • Error messaging and guidance

docs.title: Optimized Operation
docs.text:
• Minimal impact on game performance
  • Efficient network usage
  • Background processing capabilities
  • Smart caching system

docs.title: Network Management
docs.text:
• Automatic retry for failed downloads
  • Progress tracking and resumption
  • Connection status monitoring
  • Offline mode for file management

docs.title: Installation Guide
docs.text: Get LitematicDownloader up and running in just a few simple steps.

docs.title: Required Software
docs.text:
Before installing LitematicDownloader, ensure you have:

  • Minecraft: Version 1.21.6 or higher
  • Fabric Loader: Latest version recommended
  • Fabric-API: Required dependency mod

docs.title: Important Notes
docs.text:
• LitematicDownloader is currently only available for Fabric
  • Support for other loaders like Quilt or NeoForge is not provided
  • Ensure you're using the latest versions for the best experience

docs.title: Step 1: Install Fabric Loader
docs.text:
1. Visit the Fabric website
  2. Download the Fabric Installer
  3. Run the installer and select your Minecraft version (1.21.6+)
  4. Click "Install" to set up Fabric

docs.title: Step 2: Install Fabric-API
docs.text:
1. Go to Fabric-API on Modrinth or CurseForge
  2. Download the version matching your Minecraft version
  3. Place the Fabric-API .jar file in your mods folder

docs.title: Step 3: Download LitematicDownloader
docs.text:
1. Visit the Modrinth page or the GitHub Releases page
  2. Download the latest version compatible with your Minecraft version
  3. Save the mod .jar file to your computer

docs.title: Step 4: Install the Mod
docs.text:
1. Navigate to your Minecraft installation directory
  2. Open the mods folder (create it if it doesn't exist)
  3. Place the LitematicDownloader .jar file into the mods folder

docs.title: Step 5: Launch and Verify
docs.text:
1. Launch Minecraft using the Fabric profile
  2. Check that LitematicDownloader appears in your mods list
  3. Enter a world and press "N" to open the mod interface
  4. Verify the interface opens correctly

docs.title: Opening the Interface
docs.text:
• Default Keybind: "N"
  • Customization: Change in Minecraft's vanilla keybind menu
  • Menu Location: Controls → Key Binds → LitematicDownloader

docs.title: Alternative Access Methods
docs.text: If the keybind doesn't work: 1. Check for keybind conflicts in the controls menu 2. Try resetting to default keybinds 3. Restart Minecraft after making changes

docs.title: Folder Structure
docs.text:
After installation, your Minecraft directory should look like this: 

.minecraft/
├── mods/
│   ├── fabric-api-[version].jar
│   ├── litematica-[version].jar
│   └── litematic-downloader-[version].jar
└── config/
    └── litematic-downloader-settings.json

docs.title: Test Installation
docs.text:
1. Launch Minecraft with Fabric
  2. Load or create a world
  3. Press "N" to open LitematicDownloader
  4. Try browsing the schematic library
  5. Test downloading a simple schematic

docs.title: Common First-Time Setup
docs.text:
• Grant network permissions if prompted
  • Allow the mod to create necessary folders
  • Test the connection to choculaterie.com
  • Verify schematics appear in file manager

docs.title: Windows
docs.text:
• Windows Defender may prompt for network access
  • Click "Allow access" for both private and public networks
  • Add Minecraft to firewall exceptions if needed

docs.title: macOS
docs.text:
• macOS may ask for network permissions
  • Grant access in System Preferences → Security & Privacy
  • Ensure Minecraft has full disk access if needed

docs.title: Linux
docs.text:
• Most distributions don't require special permissions
  • Check firewall settings if connection issues occur
  • Ensure Java has network access permissions

docs.title: Mod Not Loading
docs.text:
• Verify Fabric Loader is properly installed
  • Check that Fabric-API is in the mods folder
  • Ensure all mods are compatible with your Minecraft version
  • Review the launcher logs for error messages

docs.title: Interface Won't Open
docs.text:
• Check the keybind configuration (default: "N")
  • Look for keybind conflicts with other mods
  • Try resetting keybinds to default
  • Restart Minecraft after making changes

docs.title: Connection Issues
docs.text:
• Verify your internet connection
  • Check if choculaterie.com is accessible
  • Review network permissions for Minecraft
  • Try refreshing the schematic list

docs.title: Getting Help
docs.text:
If you encounter issues during installation: 1. Check the FAQ section 2. Join the Discord Community 3. Report issues on GitHub

When seeking help, please include: - Your Minecraft version - Fabric Loader version - List of installed mods - Any error messages or crash logs

docs.title: Troubleshooting & Usage Guide
docs.text: This comprehensive guide will help you get the most out of LitematicDownloader and solve common issues.

docs.title: Q1: How to link client/game to website account?
docs.text:
Answer: Follow this step-by-step video tutorial: How to Link Client to Website Account

This process allows you to connect your in-game LitematicDownloader client with your choculaterie.com account for seamless publishing and management.

docs.title: Q2: How to post from the client/game?
docs.text:
Answer: Watch the detailed tutorial: How to Post from Client/Game

Learn how to publish your schematics directly from within Minecraft without ever leaving the game.

docs.title: Q3: How to link website account to Minecraft account?
docs.text:
Answer: Check out this tutorial: How to Link Website Account to Minecraft

This connection enables account integration and allows you to manage your published schematics.

docs.title: Q4: The schematics are not loading?
docs.text: Answer: 1. First, visit https://status.choculaterie.com/ to check the service status 2. If the site is healthy, try refreshing the schematic list in-game 3. Ensure Minecraft has network permissions on your system 4. Check your internet connection and firewall settings

docs.title: Q5: How to quick-share a schematic?
docs.text:
Answer: Learn about the Quick-Share feature: How to Quick-Share a Schematic

Quick-Share generates instant URLs for sharing your builds without requiring publishing or accounts.

docs.title: Q6: How to open the menu/mod?
docs.text: Answer: - Default Key: Press "N" to open the LitematicDownloader interface - Customization: You can change this keybind in Minecraft's vanilla keybind menu - Location: Controls → Key Binds → LitematicDownloader section

docs.title: Linking Your Accounts
docs.text:
1. Create choculaterie.com Account: Register on the website first
  2. Link Website to Minecraft: Follow the tutorial in Q3 above
  3. Connect Client to Website: Use the process shown in Q1 tutorial
  4. Verify Connection: Test by trying to publish a schematic

docs.title: Opening LitematicDownloader
docs.text:
1. In-Game: Press "N" (default keybind) while in any world
  2. Menu Navigation: Use mouse or keyboard to navigate
  3. Search Function: Type in the search bar to find specific schematics
  4. Categories: Browse by different build categories

docs.title: Interface Layout
docs.text:
• Search Bar: Located at the top for finding schematics
  • Category Tabs: Different sections for build types
  • Preview Panel: Shows schematic details and 3D preview
  • Download Button: Initiates the download process
  • File Manager: Access local schematic management tools

docs.title: Method 1: In-Game Interface
docs.text:
1. Browse or search for the schematic you want
  2. Click "Download" to add it to your queue
  3. Wait for the download to complete
  4. The schematic will automatically appear in your schematics folder

docs.title: Method 2: Direct URL
docs.text:
1. Download a schematic from Choculaterie.com
  2. Open LitematicDownloader file manager
  3. Drop the file in the desired folder

docs.title: File Organization
docs.text:
• Custom Folders: Create your own folder structure
  • Rename Files: Modify schematic & folder names
  • Remove Files: Delete single files or entire folder trees (e.g., removing a top-level folder will also delete all its subfolders and contained files)

docs.title: Using Search
docs.text:
• Keywords: Search by build name or description
  • Filters: Use size, category, or author filters
  • Tags: Search using specific tags
  • Advanced: Combine multiple search criteria

docs.title: Browsing Categories
docs.text:
• Recent: View recently added schematics
  • Popular: Browse most downloaded builds
  • Categories: Explore by build type (build, redstone)
  • Authors: Find builds by specific creators

docs.title: Mod Not Loading
docs.text: Problem: LitematicDownloader doesn't appear in-game Solutions: - Verify mod is in the correct mods folder - Check Minecraft version compatibility - Ensure Fabric is installed - Look for error messages in the log files

docs.title: Missing Dependencies
docs.text: Problem: Game crashes or mod features don't work Solutions: - Install Litematica mod - Update to compatible versions - Check for required library mods - Verify Fabric API version

docs.title: Downloads Failing
docs.text: Problem: Schematics won't download or fail partway Solutions: - Check internet connection - Look on the Choculaterie Status Page - Restart Minecraft

docs.title: Files Not Appearing
docs.text: Problem: Downloaded schematics don't show up in Litematica Solutions: - Check the download location setting - Refresh Litematica's file list - Look in the folder path in both mod match

docs.title: Can't Open Interface
docs.text: Problem: Unable to access LitematicDownloader menu Solutions: - Check keybind settings - Reset keybinds to default - Restart Minecraft

docs.title: Interface Not Responding
docs.text: Problem: Buttons or features don't work Solutions: - Close and reopen the interface - Check for conflicting mods - Update to latest version - Reset configuration files

docs.title: High Memory Usage
docs.text: Problem: Minecraft uses too much RAM Solutions: - Allocate more RAM to Minecraft - Update Java version

docs.title: Settings Location
docs.text:
• Config File: .minecraft/config/litematic-downloader-settings.json
  • Download Folder: Default or custom location
  • Cache Location: Temporary file storage

docs.title: Log Files
docs.text:
• Location: .minecraft/logs/latest.log
  • Search for: "LitematicDownloader" entries
  • Common Patterns: Error messages and stack traces

docs.title: Reporting Issues
docs.text:
1. Gather Information: Version numbers, error messages, steps to reproduce
  2. Check Logs: Include relevant log entries
  3. Test Isolation: Try with minimal mods installed
  4. Report: Use official channels with detailed information

docs.title: Community Resources
docs.text:
• Discord Server: Real-time help and discussion
  • GitHub Issues: Bug reports and feature requests
  • Wiki: Additional documentation and tutorials
